intro: Donax plinii, commonly known as the Italian fennel, is a flowering plant in the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its tall, slender stems and feathery, finely divided leaves. The plant produces small, white to greenish-yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to the Mediterranean region and thrives in well-drained soils. Donax plinii is often cultivated for its aromatic seeds and as an ornamental plant.
